qas.question: Powerful volcanism contributed to cause early earth to be in what state?
What occurred in the atmosphere of the earth after the crust was formed?
What size of object may have created the moon?
When water was creating the oceans what was happening to atmospheric water vapor?
What cused the Earths solid crust to become molten?
How does the mass of the moon compare to the mass of the Earth?
What broke away a piece of the earth to form the moon?
What caused water vapor to evaporate?

context: Earth was initially <a0_0>molten<a0_0/> due to extreme <b5_0>volcanism and frequent collisions<b5_0/> with other bodies. Eventually, the outer layer of the planet cooled to form <b4_0>a solid crust<b4_0/> when <a1_0>water began accumulating<a1_0/> in the atmosphere. The Moon formed soon afterwards, possibly as the result of <b7_0>a <a2_0>Mars<a2_0/>-sized object<b7_0/> with <b6_0>about 10% of the Earth's mass<b6_0/> impacting the planet in a glancing blow. Some of this object's mass merged with the Earth, significantly altering its internal composition, and a portion was ejected into space. Some of the material survived to form an orbiting moon. Outgassing and <b8_0>volcanic activity<b8_0/> produced the primordial atmosphere. <a3_0>Condensing<a3_0/> water vapor, augmented by ice delivered from comets, produced the oceans.
